normalized: the celtoana allied countries,parliament room
at one time no more than countless smallcountries that were united over 200 years ago,the alliance was formed to resist the fuluakia empire.

while the alliance now operates as asingle country, it's roots can be tracedback to a union of seperate small countries.
thus, in order to reach an agreementamongst all the members of the parliament,meetings are always prolonged several hours.
while they all have their differences, thesubject at hand for the last hundred or so yearshas been the war with the empire.

name: parliament member 1
normalized: i still do not see why it should be my territory'sresponsibility to supply that much raw material!

name: parliament member 2
normalized: i agree.
my territory will end up short oneven food if we give up that much raw material.
and so the meetings usually went.
while the war with the empire only tookplace on the front lines, the goods transportedthere were made in the countries themselves.
then the provisions and goods were carriedaway to the war zone, their benefits neverreaped by the ones who actually made them.
although, what was sent to the front lines wasnot limited to only goods and provisions.

name: parliament member 3
normalized: there have been requests to limit thedraft… it seems there is a shortageof young workers left in the cities.

name: parliament member 1
normalized: impossible.
we cannot let the number ofsoldiers on the front line fall.
each tries to spin the discussions tobenefit their own territory.
all they manageto do however, is hold each other back.

name: gagoze
normalized: hah…
it drags on.
it seems today's discussionswill end without deciding anythingonce again.

name: gagoze
normalized: （well, it's not like it bothers meany, but…）

name: parliament member 5
normalized: uh….
um…
the timid parliament member, who hadbeen silent up until now, spoke.

name: parliament member 5
normalized: i…i have a proposal i would like to make.
this one must have just recentlybecome a ruler of a territory.
all eyes gathered upon the youngparliament member.
though he hunchedover, he slowly spoke his proposal.

name: parliament member 5
normalized: um…w-why don't we try engagingin peace talks with the fuluakiaempire…?
the entire room erupted in a clamor.

name: parliament member 1
normalized: wh-what the hell are you thinking!?

name: parliament member 2
normalized: yes, why would we need to engagein peace talks with fuluakia!?
other angry members of the parliamentjoined in.

name: parliament member 5
normalized: b-but, we've been in this war for over150 years.
we are obviously running ourown lands into exhaustion.
the young parliament member continued.

name: parliament member 5
normalized: i would bet that fuluakia is ina similar position.
that is whyperhaps we should propose peace-

name: gagoze
normalized: that'd be impossible.
i interrupted him.

name: parliament member 5
normalized: eh?

name: gagoze
normalized: i said, that would be impossible.
i rested my leather boots on the table.

name: parliament member 5
normalized: c-commander aliriorge-…

name: gagoze
normalized: have you ever stood on the front lines ofwar?

name: parliament member 5
normalized: i-…i can't say that i have…
the young parliament member's eyes metmine.
my military uniform stood out fromthe expensive suits that made up the room.

name: gagoze
normalized: of course you haven't.
a territoriallord would never be drafted.
all of youjust get to sit around here all day.
never knowing the violence of the frontlines themselves, they sat in safety andstipulated the actions of war like hypocrites.
there is nothing i hate more thane hypocrites.

name: gagoze
normalized: tell me, do you want to sit down for peacetalks with the very ones who killed yourfamily and friends?
the young member of parliament, shaken bymy words, or perhaps just my hostile manner,sat in silence.

name: gagoze
normalized: or, should we strengthen our armaments,so that we can crush fuluakia as soon aswe possibly can?
what do you say, chairman?

name: chairman
normalized: hmm…
without giving a direct answer, thechairman seemed to agree with my words,and continued onto the next topic.
in general, everyone in this room couldbe seperated into 2 groups: those for thewar and those against.
however, the war that had continued for morethan 100 years robbed the parliament of reason,and the resentment for fuluakia grew stronger.
in other words, the majority wanted to fightthis war to the bitter end.

name: chairman
normalized: well then, next item on the agenda isabout the strengthening of out armaments…
and now, those who would oppose thereinforcement of the unit i lead wasreduced to less than a handfull.

name: gagoze
normalized: heh heh…
while the discussion had just begun,i already knew how it was going to end.
i smiled slightly.

name: middle-aged man
normalized: gagoze?

name: gagoze
normalized: what?
besides for strengthening the armaments,the discussions that decided nothing had ended.
someone suddenly called for me.

name: gagoze
normalized: ahh, why if it isn't azrael.
turning around, i saw a middle-aged elf.
it was the head of the azrael family.
hewas an advocate of the war, like i.

name: head of azrael
normalized: thank you for coming out all the wayfrom the front lines today.

name: gagoze
normalized: heh, well, if i don't sit in on a few ofthese meetings every now and then, how am igoing to coordinate anything with you guys?
and how would i stop utter nonsensefrom being spoken, like it was today?
thinking it over, i looked once more atthe middle-aged elf.
the azrael family.
they were once famous royal knights infuluakia.
but about 100 years ago they hadpolitical dispute, or so i hear.
in the end, they were exiled for theirpolitical disagreements.
they have beendevoted to the war ever since.
but i do not know what fuels theirhatred for their own mother country.
perhaps there is a reason in their past.
however, after being exiled to allianceterritories, they have stood on the frontlines.
they are popular among the people.

name: gagoze
normalized: （anyway, i guess it's good to havehim on my side in the discussions.
if he were an advocate of peace, i'dhave a hard time going against him.
i'mglad he's an ally.
at a glance, that was my evaluation ofthe gentle-looking middle-aged elf.

name: head of azrael
normalized: but gagoze, i mean, commander aliriorge,don't you suppose you have been overdoingit a little bit lately?

name: gagoze
normalized: eh?
i had never thought i would hear thewords that came next come from the manwho always championed the war.

normalized: ah…
what's this old man up to…

name: gagoze
normalized: that's the first time i've heard that.
i keeprecords of all funds spent, and i report themeach month.

name: head of azrael
normalized: i see… well then, that will do.
but,gagoze?
i'm not sure if he was actually satisfiedwith my answer or not.

name: head of azrael
normalized: do not forget, the funds we use come fromthe peoples' taxes.
but the words that came next resembledthe nonsense that young parliament memberwas spouting earlier.

name: head of azrael
normalized: soldiers exist to protect and servethe country.
you must not forget that.
had he not been the old man thathe was, i would have punched him rightthere.
but…

name: gagoze
normalized: haha, azrael, you're startingto sound like one of those fuluakianknights.
i swallowed my anger towards himand forced a smile.

name: gagoze
normalized: although, your grandfather was the sub-commander of the fuluakian knights, correct?
perhaps you have inherited some of it.
i joked, hiding my irritation with the oldman.

name: head of azrael
normalized: ha ha… no, i do not think so.
perhaps i had no reason to be worriedabout you, gagoze.
the old man returned my smile.
…sometimes i'm not sure wherethe old man's real intentions lie.

name: head of azrael
normalized: my apologies.
the reason i called onyou is actually another matter entirely.
it seems i've gotten forgetful in my old age.
what's going on in that old man's head…?
i didn't have time to try and figureit out.

name: head of azrael
normalized: daness, come here.

name: young girl
normalized: yes, grandfather.

name: gagoze
normalized: huh?

name: young girl
normalized: how do you do, commander aliriorge.
i have heard of your deeds from mygrandfather.
i am honored to meet you.

name: gagoze
normalized: and you are?

name: daness
normalized: daness c.
azrael, sir.
i have beenassigned to your command as of this day.

name: gagoze
normalized: azrael?
hearing that name, i turned to themiddle-aged elf standing next to her.

normalized: yes, she is my grandchild.
i was goingto entrust her training to you.
the head of the azrael family nodded.

name: gagoze
normalized: i see…

a duty that is now being pushed upon

normalized: so, in other words, you're next in lineto be the head of the azrael family?

name: daness
normalized: that is correct.
perhaps she was just nervous, butshe was stiff from her head to her toes.
i looked up and down.

name: gagoze
normalized: （even so…）
she had pretty nice body.
you could see her curves even under thefull formal dress of the alliance uniform.

normalized: let's try not to be so formal, okay?

i turned on myheel.

name: gagoze
normalized: 2 hours from now, we will return tothe front lines.
be ready by then.

name: daness
normalized: yes sir.

the two were now left alone.

name: daness
normalized: grandfather…that's the man…?

normalized: yes…

normalized: i am sorry, daness.
